item.title: Repairing partition with input/output error
item.description: After an unclean shutdown, my home partition failed again. Unfortunately, using alternate superblocks didn’t help, all of them gave me the following error in the end of the output generated by e2fsck: Error writing block 1 (input/output error). Ignore error? I ran smartctl -a /dev/xxx, and found this: # 2 Extended offline Completed: read failure 00% 13771 6960152 A serious problem might had happened. So I did the following: Using ddrescue to copy the whole partition to an image.

item.title: Repairing a corrupted file system
item.description: I occasionally ran into file system problems these days. At the fisrt few times, I just ran fsck and then reboot, but it failed today when my system tried to mount my home device, and systemctl status home.mount gave me the following errors: home.mount: Mounting timed out. Terminating. home.mount: Mount process exited, code=killed, status=15/TERM home.mount: Failed with result 'timeout'. I noticed that I hadn’t used persistent block device naming in my fstab, so I edited the file to change the naming by label.
